result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendra Pauline Pierce

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Kendra Pauline Pierce appeared. Includes 15CF481, 16CM112 and 16CM591. Case called at 2:11 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. Court amends Count #3 in 16CM591 to County Ordiance #52. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Recess. Case recalled at 2:41 pm. Def would like to continue with Plea. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1 in 15CF481 and Amended Count #3 in 16CM591. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1 15CF481 and amended Count #3 in 16CM591. Court dismisses Count #2 in 15CF481, Count #1 in 16CM112 read in and dismissed for restitution, Count #2 is dismissed. Court dismisses Counts #1 and #2 in 16CM591. Atty's make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court orders: On 15CF481, Court orders 1 yr probation w/h with conditions - 
- 90 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs $243.00
- Restitution - $419.82 to Hudson Physicians, $5.50 to Dollar General. Apply Bond.
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200.00
- AODA within 45 Days
- Complete treatment with Dr. Moller
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- No Abusive Contact with J. Moreno
- No Contact with Hudson Hospital or Dollar General in Roberts, Wi.
- Apology Letter within 30 Days
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Def shall appear in court on 5/1/2017
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 3/1/2017 at 3:45 pm. 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

On 16CM591
- Court Costs $250.00  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Filed by ADA Correll. km
Status conference at 04-18-2016 10:30 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Dollar General in Roberts, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
